trans-unit.source: When working with an app in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, you can view details related to the unique identity assigned to it by the Windows Store and get a link to your app's Store listing.
trans-unit.target: When working with an app in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, you can view details related to the unique identity assigned to it by the Windows Store and get a link to your app's Store listing.

trans-unit.source: View app identity details
trans-unit.target: View app identity details

trans-unit.source: View app identity details
trans-unit.target: View app identity details

trans-unit.source: When working with an app in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, you can view details related to the unique identity assigned to it by the Windows Store and get a link to your app's Store listing.
trans-unit.target: When working with an app in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, you can view details related to the unique identity assigned to it by the Windows Store and get a link to your app's Store listing.

trans-unit.source: To find this info, navigate to one of your apps, then expand **App management** in the left navigation menu.
trans-unit.target: To find this info, navigate to one of your apps, then expand **App management** in the left navigation menu.

trans-unit.source: Click **App identity** to view these details.
trans-unit.target: Click **App identity** to view these details.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You need to have a [reserved name](create-your-app-by-reserving-a-name.md) for your app in order to see most of these identity details.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You need to have a [reserved name](create-your-app-by-reserving-a-name.md) for your app in order to see most of these identity details.

trans-unit.source: Values to include in your appx manifest
trans-unit.target: Values to include in your appx manifest

trans-unit.source: The following values must be included in your appx manifest.
trans-unit.target: The following values must be included in your appx manifest.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Microsoft Visual Studio to build your packages, and are signed in with the same Microsoft account that you have associated with your developer account, these details are included automatically.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Microsoft Visual Studio to build your packages, and are signed in with the same Microsoft account that you have associated with your developer account, these details are included automatically.

trans-unit.source: If you're building your package manually, you'll need to add these in.
trans-unit.target: If you're building your package manually, you'll need to add these in.

trans-unit.source: Package/Identity/Name
trans-unit.target: Package/Identity/Name

trans-unit.source: Package/Identity/Publisher
trans-unit.target: Package/Identity/Publisher

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [**Identity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211441) in the [package manifest schema reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211473).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [**Identity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211441) in the [package manifest schema reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211473).

trans-unit.source: Together, these elements declare the identity of your app, establishing the "package family" to which all of its packages belong.
trans-unit.target: Together, these elements declare the identity of your app, establishing the "package family" to which all of its packages belong.

trans-unit.source: Individual packages will have additional details, such as architecture and version.
trans-unit.target: Individual packages will have additional details, such as architecture and version.

trans-unit.source: Additional values for package family
trans-unit.target: Additional values for package family

trans-unit.source: The following values are additional values that refer to your app's package family, but are not included in your manifest.
trans-unit.target: The following values are additional values that refer to your app's package family, but are not included in your manifest.

trans-unit.source: **Package Family Name (PFN)**: This value is used with certain Windows APIs.
trans-unit.target: **Package Family Name (PFN)**: This value is used with certain Windows APIs.

trans-unit.source: **Package SID**: You'll need this value to send WNS notifications to your app.
trans-unit.target: **Package SID**: You'll need this value to send WNS notifications to your app.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187203).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187203).

trans-unit.source: Link to your app's listing
trans-unit.target: Link to your app's listing

trans-unit.source: The link to your app's page can be shared to help your customers find the app in the Store.
trans-unit.target: The link to your app's page can be shared to help your customers find the app in the Store.

trans-unit.source: This link is in the format **https://www.microsoft.com/store/apps/<your app's Product ID>**.
trans-unit.target: This link is in the format **https://www.microsoft.com/store/apps/<your app's Product ID>**.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Depending on what OS versions you're targeting, you may see more than one link here.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Depending on what OS versions you're targeting, you may see more than one link here.

trans-unit.source: All apps will show the URL for Windows 10 using the format noted above, which will work for any OS.
trans-unit.target: All apps will show the URL for Windows 10 using the format noted above, which will work for any OS.

trans-unit.source: You may see additional links for Windows 8.1 and earlier and/or Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, which will work only on the specified OS versions.
trans-unit.target: You may see additional links for Windows 8.1 and earlier and/or Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, which will work only on the specified OS versions.

trans-unit.source: When a customer clicks this link, it will open the web-based listing page for your app.
trans-unit.target: When a customer clicks this link, it will open the web-based listing page for your app.

trans-unit.source: If your app is available for the customer's Windows device, the Store app will also launch and display your app's listing.
trans-unit.target: If your app is available for the customer's Windows device, the Store app will also launch and display your app's listing.
